meanings.definition: The act of making a strong declaration or assertion.
meanings.sent1: Her protestation of innocence was met with skepticism by the jury.
meanings.sent2: The witness's protestation of the events helped clarify the situation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his protestation, no one believed he had seen a unicorn.
meanings.sent4: Her protestation of love for him was as clear as day.
meanings.sent5: The protestation of the students for better food was heard by the school administration.

meanings.definition: A formal declaration or affirmation of a statement or fact.
meanings.sent1: The protestation of the treaty was signed by both countries.
meanings.sent2: His protestation of loyalty to the company was well-received by his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The protestation of the cat that it didn't eat the fish was met with suspicion.
meanings.sent4: The protestation of the sun rising every morning is a constant in our lives.
meanings.sent5: The protestation of the scientist that the earth is round was groundbreaking at the time.
